EToMNQxt1qxrbVKxL1MKtg.text: one of the best burgers i've had in London and the wings were great too.  the wait sucked but it was worth it in the end

BXZIXD9dovSoLYhBLQ-qXg.text: it would get 5* if not for the excruciating wait.P&B is tucked toward the end of James street (almost on wigmore st) between the shisha place and the tanning shop.  a bench outside where hipsters sit and wait - please note... it is not permitted to queue outside the tan-shop so the queue loops around in a circle.Had the smokey robinson and ari gold.  agree with other reviews so won't repeat.  There is no dessert menuprepare for a wait over 1 hour outside to get in and actually wrap up eating within 20 mins... idk if this means that it IS worth the wait.. all I can say is... please don't go when hungry b/c you'll end up almost resenting service for being so quick with your order and that you have to leave asap. (ie within 20 mins of going in the door)the thunderthighs in jalepeno sauce were "fall-off-the-bone" tender... but the skin wasn't crisp... so had to move to the side....overall really good. what I saw around me was ppl getting them in the tamarind sauce (version).the fries/chips with the chicken skin bits mayo were okay... but I couldn't really taste any outstanding flavour in the mayo... so not sure if worth the extra 75p for the mayo.  on the table there is mayo and ketchup and they bring hot sauce and mustard if you want.  plenty for your chips.  FOOD: overall REALLY tasty grub, definitely on the greasy side, the burger meat cooked to your liking, chips are good, thighs good.. all seemed done right.AMBIENCE: very loud music which is fine b/c you're practically sitting next to strangers... so a bit of buffer is not discouraged.  quick service and quite attentive. Servers are quite easy going and may bust a move to the rhythm of the background music.   These was OUR order1 smoky robinson1 ari gold1 side of chips with mayo1 side of jalapeno soaked thunderthighs1 diet coke1 lemonade For £32 (including tip)hope this helps :)

LGWq7CiArgnHT9wjoYLRCQ.text: Great burgers and crispy chips! Service is phenomenal and food came out perfect and hot! Tables are rather cozy....

gFbKdkLavDSciRjWhQdtgQ.text: Great little place that have lovely juicy burgers or a portobello mushroom burger for those veggies out there. Instead of traditional buns they use brioches which just positively melt in your mouth. The meat was cooked to perfection and the condiments complemented the meal perfectly.Went here last night in a group of 5. We had to wait 25 minutes which for a Saturday peak time isn't too bad, especially considering it's only a 30 seater.The staff are really friendly and the ambiance is very bohemian and young.Burgers are £7.50-£8.50 and a portion of chips is £2.50.A can of soft drink is £1.50, which for that price really should be a bottle.

Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom

K0P7xNZknWwCD9YmQXSnrA.text: Ok so I dislike clothes shopping but I had to buy a suit on Oxford Street so thought I'd treat myself to a burger and have wanted to go here for a while. So went in on my own (I know lame Billy no mates). I had the smokey Robinson and a beer. Oh my god! It was amazing I smashed it down in about 3 minutes then felt bad for not savouring it. From what I remember in the short period it graced my tongue it was the best burger I have ever eaten and I'm not joking. The bread was beautiful and sweet, the burger juicy and so much flavour! The bacon lovely and the salt contrasting with the sweet bun mmmmm. Might have to go get another now I've written this.

U053jBv6ra7wsttp3fHivQ.text: These are some of the best burgers I've had in the recent months. It's a cozy place, with industrial style decor and small wood tables. I ordered their mushroom veggie burger which was amazing, not too heavy. Their buns are fresh and so tasty, it makes a huge difference! Their fries topped with rosemary are also mouth watering. It's important to note that the burgers weren't that greasy and I didn't feel like a piece of lard after stuffing my face (which is mostly how I feel after most burger joints). Ambience is causal, and they place great Indie-pop tunes, just at the right level so that it doesn't take over conversations. Must go, and don't wear anything light colored. Guaranteed mess while eating! Enjoy!

EpurVMHa-cZX8AfJwzZM6w.text: We went here about a year ago, just before it was listed in Time Out magazine and have never been able to get a seat since. (I'm not a fan of queuing...) But last Monday at around 8ish we decided to give it another go, with great success. Managed to get  a seat straight away, ordered, ate and left all within about 20 mins! The burgers are amazing. They are, without doubt, one of the best burgers I've eaten and any other burger pales in comparison. We had the Ari Gold, which is your basic cheese burger, but the sauces and the picked onions and everything that comes on top with a brioche bun makes it juicy perfection. The burgers are cooked medium as standard, so there's a lot of pink, but I think it adds to it. I like to put the chips on the paper underneath the burger, so that they can soak up all the juices that drip down.My only complaint this time was the music, seriously.. it was 8pm on a Monday night and I couldn't hear my husband talk it was so ridiculously loud. P&B aren't the only ones guilty of this crime, it seems to be par for the course at the moment, but it's a really off putting feature. I appreciate the need for a 'vibe' but, just turn it down.. I actually spent the time waiting for my food with my fingers in my ears.Would definitely have received 5* had it not been for that.

1BBlhrsDkswMiJWcSsMrsQ.text: They've somehow made brioche buns into anything but soft. Service is pretty atrocious here (is there staff training on how to be incredibly rude? twice the waitresses bumped into our tables and blamed it on us and we were given the bill midway into our meal then asked to pay as soon as we could) and they still expect a 10% tip. You're better off going to Shake Shack at Covent Garden, or Five Guys in Soho. This place is as disappointing as zero stars. Avoid at all costs.

dgdswJaHzbLX3kWWEn3wPw.text: Fluffy patties on brioche beds, like the name itself suggests! In a rustic, recycle-consious card-box-looking environment I had an affair with 'Jose-Jose', my burger of choice. A couple of minutes after taking my seat  a mountain of pickled red onions, a medium-rare beef patty with chorizo relish, smoked cheese, lettuce and tomato landed on my table. On the side, home-made crunchy chips coated with aromatic rosemary salt. Pricewise, the meal costed approximately £10 (drinks excluded). The burgers and the sides are separated, allowing creative combinations. Add a Red Stripe for £4. The BBC counting our bites added to the experience! UP:- Forks and knives are officially not needed. It's a burger joint after-all! - An additional portion of chips that was accidentally added in our order arrived free of charge. - At around 4.30pm, no queue for us! - Male model sightings! :p DOWN:- All dinners should be present before sitting on the table. In other words, you cannot occupy a table of five if only three of you are on location waiting for the other two to arrive shortly. Bummer.  - The optional service was already included in the bill, meaning that the actual food cost was not easy to calculate and decide about the amount of the tips. - Male models eating burgers. In your face. :p VERDICT:Like and Follow!

niTsShkoM3MQ9BIWJ2onpQ.text: Like any carnivorous lady in the City, I am partial to a good beef burger. Heck I would even pay close to a tenner to get that perfect burger (for the US readers that is almost 15 dollars which we Brits find reasonable for London and you may not). Patty and Bun hit quite the right spot- a small selection of excellent burgers. They manage to cook them to perfection- medium rare- a feat I imagine quite tricky considering how busy this place gets. The only side that is really worth mentioning are the fries, which I highly recommend. It is small- emphasis on the small, and can get quite cramped, so avoid if you get offended by sharing a table or hitting your head on the rather low hanging lamp shades. Also by all means do not try and come here at lunch times or high peak times unless you love to que. I was fortunate enough to not have to do so and was quickly served by the friendly and hip staff. The "Lambshank Redemption" and "Smoking Robinson" burgers were a personal favourite!

7glM3WIkbcMxLBdG6ii2cA.text: Very small place after reading reviews I decide to get take away. I have actually walked past this place numerous times and never gave it much thought as I felt that it was just another burger joint. When I saw all the raving reviews and it was around the corner from where I was working I thought why not as I needed something quick and most places in the area are sit down slow service places. I was very torn which burger to order as they all sounded amazing but after reading reviews a settled on the Ari gold. Ari gold had great flavours and I would fully recommend it but next time I'm going to branch out and try the Jose Jose or the smokey Robinson. The fries/chips where nice as they had rosemary baked into them. I am still a GBK and meat liqueur fan but this place gives a bit of a competition. Worth a try !

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom. Ari gold cheeseburger with chips/fries
Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom. Bill. For take away

R0UpppWuZe9QZd2kRKpQLA.text: Oh man! I really enjoyed the Ari Gold burger (+bacon) here. I would add a fried egg if they offered it. This ranks among the top burgers I've ever had. The chips with rosemary salt (fries) is a must with the burger (at least for me it is). I wanted to try the chicken too but this is a burger joint and I LOVE burgers so I didn't want to risk the potential disappointment. On my next trip to London, I'm definitely headed here! (Hopefully multiple times) One of the few restaurants that I follow on Instagram. Please bring your restaurant to California!

IeqVvjBroYBwW3XvYojjnQ.text: My favourite burgers hands down, and london has lots of great burgers so that's saying something! Don't miss out on the chicken wings as well, absolutely superb :) Only trouble is the snaking long queues, so not too suitable for larger groups(will end up waiting forever), but just avoid peak dining times plus they do takeaway as well!

ko2NkQi3Yet9piPZm4JT7w.text: Many times I walked pass this place, and never dared trying entering because of the queues at the entrance...However this time I was there at noon sharp by luck, and we decided to enter this small burger place to understand why people queued. And I was simply very happy with my burger. Real good juicy meat cooked as I wanted it.A special mention for the fries: excellent. They had some spices on them before cooking which gives them a great taste, and they are nicely crispy. We also tried the chicken burger, but nothing special to mention here, it's just a regular chicken burger. Clearly this is a great place I would recommend for a nice burger with good meat. As for the service, quick and efficient.

uH6bUVS-4W9tCbjrrIifYA.text: This cool place in the center of London is an highly reviewed Hamburger restaurant, so we decided to try it. Our expectations were dashed. The quality of the products is very high for sure, but what about the taste we found it ordinary. Nothing special. If you have to pay 10£ for an hamburger it should be more than just good.

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom. Smokey Robinson

oD-HqmrVZ9Cw9LwNnkisDg.text: Really great wings (if you like BBQ) and burgers! Cozy venues too. One of our favorite burgers in London!

5-nDqoUODry7ntvPmQ154A.text: The best burgers in London!Be ready to queue to get in, but it's definately worth the wait. Recommend the 'Smoking Robinson' burger and the homemade peanut butter choc-ices.Always great service with a cool and trendy atmosphere.A personal favourite!

E6YGsbziC2piyCoMH68KqA.text: Oh Yeah, now we're talking bidniz!My favourite burger in Central London by a mile but the only pain is that damn queue. O M G what's the deal with all these queues everywhere? The queue snaked up and down the front of the shop and it took us over an hour to get inside, and this was just late afternoon!Anyway enough of my moaning, after being seated I wanted to start eating cos I was planning a long night of beer drinking and needed something to line my stomach. I had the ARI Gold cheeseburger with fries and slaw (mental note never by slaw again, ever!) and chicken wings as an after thought. The burger was spot on, brioche bun, gooey cheese mixed with beef juices from a medium patty mmmm patty come to daddy. Great tasting burger and good fries. The wings were lame as they are coated with something and I just didn't rate them. Menu is small as with all these places but it could have done with onion rings. I would return for the burger but the queue frightens the life out of me. If I were in the immediate area I'd definitely eat there again but so far haven't managed to return. This is a must eat burger in Central London.

rKA5bEnqgs38sGq1dIVFwA.text: I always walk by this place and see ridiculously long queues, so, assuming that meant it was good, I made sure that we hit up Patty & Bun as part of the Burger Tour before half of our contingent returned to the US.The food is all right. The fries are a little too salty and the portions are on the smaller side given the price. We arrived at 12 exactly and had no problem getting a table for six, but beware that if you arrive even at 12:15 there will be a queue. They also make you collect your entire party before sitting down, otherwise, when you get to the front of the line they won't seat you.I think we would have had a better experience if we ordered takeaway and went to the park to enjoy our meal without the ambient stress of knowing that others are waiting for your table. Patty & Bun is fine, the burgers are solid, but I think it's maybe not worth the hype.

DSoQwbp-jDMMjXsGHsdlsQ.text: The opening hours are not correct. They claim to be open until 11 but they stop orders at 10:15.

gcN7BCMCFCJiF4sB7tGWPg.text: It was FOURTH time lucky for me to actually get a seat in here. They must of known it was my birthday as I didnt have to wait, though having someone (Mrs K) queue up for me helped too :-DI had the Smokey Robinson burger, in which the smokiness really was awesome, perfect amount of smokiness and good tasting burger. Fries were also pretty good.My only two gripes were:a) I had forgotten how much I dislike Red Stripe, which is the only beer they have (i think there are guest-beers too?)b) My burger was greasier than a a pole in Spearmint Rhino.The service was good though, and everyone very friendly. All in all, I was happy with the experience; fellow diners were happy with their mushroom and mushroom dressed as lamb-burgers.

bJVTQGP5B5_sjEGG-BkGkw.text: Very high end of 4 stars, and definitely one of the best burgers I've had in London.Restaurant:The restaurant itself is tiny. It has a really fun casual feel though. Wooden tables and some really cool cardboard box artwork on the walls (e.g. there was a box with a sword painted on it and it said "caution: made in china" on the side).Unfortunately with the size comes the wait. We got there at 1210 for lunch on a Thursday and were seated around 1245 (for a group of 4). 2 groups of 2s who came behind us were seated first though so it's probably best to go with just one other person. That being said, there's something about the whole patty & bun experience that's best shared so maybe just go in a group but be sure you go off peak.Food:I had the 'Ari Gold' (essentially a cheeseburger). I can only imagine that eating this was as satisfying as getting a hug from the man himself would be because it's definitely one of the best burgers I've had anywhere. The burger features an incredible patty. Cooked to perfection (medium-rare), insanely juicy and a perfect size. 4 stars because I would have liked the patty itself to be a tiny bit more flavourful, so a tad more seasoning would have been welcome.Patty aside it's complimented with cheese, mayo, pickled red onions, tomato and lettuce (you can add bacon though I didn't). The buns here deserve special mention because they really stand out. All these ingredients are sandwiched between the most amazing looking golden toasted brioche. The bread itself is light but retains its shape perfectly and doesn't crumble, even with the juiciness of the burger and the amount of sauce inside.We each also got an order of the rosemary salt fries. These were spot on, and definitely worth ordering.Overall:My mouth is watering as I'm writing this...

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom. The 'Ari Gold'

MIY1Aj593x5XtR63zvOc7Q.text: I have been wanting to try Patty & Bun since I first arrived in London. Tonight I finally got to go. We waited in the queue for about 40-50 minutes. It was worth it. Two of us got the Smokey Robinson burger, and it was one of the best burgers I've ever had. The BBQ mayo sauce was delicious and the beef was cooked perfectly. My other friend got the chicken burger and she loved it as well. We also split chips and wings. The chips were good but nothing too special. The wings were excellent and included lots of meat.The waitresses and host were all very nice and friendly. For how busy this place is, service is very efficient. The music is loud, but I don't mind it. Some older customers might not enjoy this as much.Overall, I will definitely be back. Next time I want to try the Ari Gold burger.

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom. Smokey Robinson burger

qaPwvTeto03FsuO2SSeIGQ.text: We came straight here after we got off the plane in London. It hits the spot every time!You can never go wrong with the Hot Chic, juicy/crunchy fried chicken burger, the Ari Gold, perfect steak burger with all the right toppings! Really you cant go wrong with anything named Ari Gold! and a side of fries and wings!Wings are soft and juicy and drowned in sauce! Yum!!Definitely a must have in London! Drooling already writing about it...

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom. Hot Chic in the Flesh!!
Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom. Hot Chic, Ari Gold, Fries and Wings! The perfect Combo!

_xKsR7nD4q0Vmm68Vy40sw.text: Luckily me and my friends didnt wait too long. The burgers were definitely very tasty and I dont have too much to add to other reviews.1. Apparently they changed up their fryer so the chips are now browner and more crispy - definitely a plus in my book.2. Ive never really eaten a burger to bass, house, and jungle music before - I can definitely get use to this ;)

jFjke4A3JvEhy9NhGrEItQ.text: You come here for the burgers, and I ordered the Ari Gold, with bacon. I would call this a regrettably forgettable burger. It tasted good, but was truly nothing special. Chicken skin fries were good, and so were the chili chicken legs, but again they will soon be forgotten. Prices are a little high, since everything is al a carte . Beer is way expensive (find a near by pub). If you need to try it because of its reputation, then feel free, but I wouldn't wait in line for too long.

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom. Ari gold, chicken skin fries, and chicken legs.

1qgpupPqQjZu3hOuUXsOvw.text: Best burger in London. If you are on a diet, fear greasy deliciousness, and enjoy tasteless fast food burgers... Then this place is not for you.The 20 min wait outside is completely worth it, the music is loud and gets you excited for a night out. The staff is friendly, fast, and efficient. The burgers.... There are no words, You have to eat one to understand. All in all, it is more than a burger, it is an experience... If you can handle it.

bq5Kb_7zWyPcjVz7gvH9KA.text: I think Patty & Bun continue to nail it with their specials. The burger with pork and... I don't know. It was a fantastic burger though. The crunchy chicken burger is also a winner - pro tip, get one of each and ask the waitress to half them for sharing. Unless you go by yourself, then relax because noone will see you eating two burgers. The fries are good, but not necessary. The wings were over sweet for my taste and I once had a stewed meat fries ball thing here that was awful. I admire their continued creativity though. The worst aspect is the queue that usually forms outside. 15 minutes wait was not too bad though. The beers are ok, but I'd like to see the menu lengthened as the longhorn IPA is just ok. For a standard burger, my pick goes to Burger & Lobster btw. So stick to the more complex concoctions.

vt_HL88qKndKDlOk4bIutA.text: For the longest time I didn't understand how my friends could worship a burger place so religiously and why anybody would want to do the half hour wait regularly, but now I do. Simply the best burger in town. Try it out.I know most rave about the traditional cheeseburger (extra bacon is a must), but the lamb blew me away. So as somebody else suggests - go if a friend, order two kind of burgers, split them. They are all worth a try!

wPWK3p8CzXKNBHIRrrhCIw.text: Very tasty for a burger but feels rather u healthy (probably noone cares anyway though)

3LOGdD0kbL5c1f2DqBzzeg.text: Smokey Robinson is a classic with very tasty slice of becon. Don't forget to order very good chips, finally give a try to the local beer specialities!

jKVTIH3GwmpMO6abvC-mdw.text: The best burger I've had in the grey city so far!Turned up just after 8:30PM on a Saturday, waited in the cold like a fiend for around 20 mins (not too bad)....+ PointsGreat selection of musicFabolous foodNice locationFriendly staffGood atmosphere- PointsLack of selection on starters/sidesOne over friendly member of staff (borderline nutters)!Lack of space (very pokey, almost sent my friends burger flying with my elbow)!The Rum Punch certainly knocked me sideways (always expect these to be weak at restaurants, this wasn't). All in all I'm definitely going back, I had a real good time and will spread the word!

Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom. The illest chicken wings I've ever tasted...! Ever so rich but hella divine! Get involved...!

-wDzqQ2HlkqI7xi7WOVaSQ.text: This astonishing burger joint, tucked away in London, was truly able to engage all of my 5 senses.  I have never been blown away by such an amazing hamburger, fries, wait staff, seating, and overall atmosphere in my entire life.  I cannot stop talking about this amazing experience so all I will say is you need to check it out for yourself.  Currently, I'm adjusting my travel plans to make sure I can eat there one more time before returning to South Africa for a work project.

no5ZAVchnKdFsLHRuVNysw.text: There's a patty in my buns and everyone's invited.In 80 years time, society will probably be horrified by the gastronomic decadence of our time, shocked at the calorific value of our foods, our bingeing, our excesses, illustrated most poignantly by the burger boom of the early 2010s.  Pictures of vile people, stuffing oversized, greasy, dripping, wasteful burgers into their faces (juxtaposed with photos of starving children, no doubt) will adorn the history textbooks, along with snarky captions about how attitudes have since changed.  I can imagine that Patty& Bun will be one of the poster children for this nutritional austerity movements...it has everything: meat, grease, and droves of queuing customers.Honestly, I never intended to wait an hour for burgers.  I'm pretty against waiting for restaurants, but a certain Yelp member insisted so I relented.  After all, I had been meaning to go to P&B for a while (their street stall being excellent), so I figured it would be ok.  Well, it would've been if it hadn't been a Friday night.  ANYWAY.An hour and a bit later we were in!  Yes, P&B don't take names and call.  You have to wait out there like sad sacks whilst you wistfully look at the people finishing up AND TAKING AGES TO PAY THEIR SODDING BILL AND GET UP AND LEAVE.  Luckily, summer makes this ok.  P&B is smallish with a cosy interior - they've really nailed the shack chic (it's certainly more of a shack than that other burger place in Covent Garden), right down to the dearth of crockery.I've meant to try the other burgers but I've only ever had the Smokey Robinson because onions.  I can't resist caramelised onions.  I also don't really get the naming references, but either way it's all moot.  This is the archetypal slopfest that will shock future generations. It's a pornographically messy burger which oozes and drips and melts everywhere with that awesome medium rare patty (cue salivation) with a nice aged tinge to it along with the smokiness and the onions and the sauce all over the face.  I mean, it's just one of those things you have to experience.  I don't have definitive burger rankings, but this is possibly the top. They're so good that I don't remember how good the chips are - I know they're decent, but they're probably ranked a little below Honest.  Not sure.  Oh, and we decided to get the confit chicken wings because, y'know, a gigantic hunk of beef isn't enough.  The sauce is great, but whilst the meat falls off the bone I kind of felt that the texture's somewhat...amorphous.  I dunno.  It was a little too soft for my liking.  Didn't stop me from eating a bunch, obviously.On balance, I love the P&B experience.  I just can't justify giving 5*s to somewhere which requires an hour of queuing.  Hey, I'm all for delayed gratification but really, no-one needs to see me when I'm hungry.  With that said, I am yet to leave P&B without feeling a little bit disgusted with myself (more things that future generations won't understand).  Disgusted with what I have become and how I, single handedly, am creating food shortages around the world.  But I will go back again.  And again.  Because I'm a disgusting backwards savage from the 2010s.

cvCDnclqXlyEiJiVk4A4TQ.text: I absolutely loved this place. The food, the service, the atmosphere. Reminded me of a place in Santa Monica, CA. It was not busy at all when I went for lunch, granted it was during the week, with quality of food this good I can't imagine how it's not packed 24/7. I ordered the classic with the boneless wings, I don't remember what flavor, believe BBQ. They were SO tender and the meat was so moist, I couldn't decide which I loved more, the burger or the wings. If you are craving a great burger and some wings, I highly recommend Patty & Bun!

zykIqP-Sxw4ifb3XlI4RxQ.text: After seeing this place hitting number one burger in the world according to a telegraph newspaper article, I just had to try it out for myself when in London! I got the smokey burger which is tolped with carmalised onions, bacon, cheese, lettuce tomato and smokey mayo!! The burger meat itself was about an inch thick and was cooked to perfection at medium rare!! All in all absolutely delicious!! The fries topped with chicken skin salt and chicken skin mayo.... nom nom nom! So good!! Yes you probably will have a bit of a queue (moves quite efficiently) and they arent the cheapest burger in the world but you pay for quality meat and topping!! Patty and bun is a must for any burger lover passing visiting London!!

Z_dAv8JsOkmgONZIUHhmlA.text: There was quite the queue outside for this deservedly popular burger joint in London. The staff were good enough to come outside and note the names of those waiting.  I chose to grab my order as take out (no waiting!) and eat in nearby and quiet Cavendish Square.I was recommended the Ari Gold burger with Bacon and it didn't disappoint. The brioche was sweet, beef patty melted away and the pickles with smokey P&B Mayo added a nice bit of sharpness. It's all quite rich but is definitely one of the tastiest burgers in town

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom. P&B burger to go
Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom. "ARI GOLD" Cheeseburger from Patty & Bun

LaU1HTZ0w097yaRvrjrHKw.text: I've heard a lot of good things about Joe and his burgers, so I was really excited to try one at the FEAST food festival. I rocked up and ordered the 'Smokey Robinson' which contained a beef patty, cheese, lettuce, caramelized onion, bacon, ketchup and smokey p & b mayo all nestled in between a brioche bun, mouth watering yet? Well it should because it was one of the best burgers I have ever tasted, the patty had a nice pink tinge to it and was seasoned just right,  the sweetness of the caramelized  onions mixed well with the saltiness of the bacon, and p & b mayo gave the whole thing a slight smokey flavour, and it was messy as hell to eat, just pure awesomeness and burger filth.I also hear on the food grapevine that Patty & Bun are heading to a permanent location real soon, so keep your eyes peeled for that.

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom. Joe cooking up some treats.

3ruAG7Gc74aYlhiN2PNzBw.text: Is it my fault? Perhaps, but I had MASSIVE hopes for P&B. Sky high. They were, I'm afraid, not lived up to. The hype, the expectations, were not met.Why?The burger patty was cooked perfectly, juicy, but tasteless, not even the charred flavour Meatmarket has. There wasn't enough cheese. The bun was brioche solid and held the fillings competently but was hideously sweet and ruined the burger with every sweet bready whiff.The chips, however, were awesome, crispy and soft in the right places, decent flavour, overly salty but the way chips should be.Service was good, efficiently organising the queues. Drinks choices were boring but the special burger sounded great.I mean this with love, if you are thinking of getting an amazing burger, go to Bleecker St in Spitalfield's, nothing compares to that and if you do, you will never need P&B.

mNqRjbdus0wlzwNp1jO90Q.text: I have a long list of places in London that I want to dine in and last night I crossed one of them off my list - patty&bun.If truth be told my girlfriend and I were originally heading for MEATliquor, but our rumbling bellies didn't agree with the long queue. Luckily for us patty&bun was just around the corner.There was still a queue outside, but nowhere near as big. A friendly waiter came out to greet us and took down my name, he informed us we would have to wait 30-35 minutes. The wait was more like 20 minutes max - happy days.The restaurant can only fit about 30 people, so you do feel a bit packed in, but the staff are friendly and the atmosphere is nice and chilled.I ordered the 'Ari Gold' burger (with no tomato and no onions) and my girlfriend had the 'Smokey Robinson', we both had the chips with rosemary salt.We were impressed with how quickly the food arrived and liked the packaging.The burgers were quite greasy, but tasty none the less. The p&b mayo is delicious so make sure to take advantage of the bottle on your table.They cook the burgers medium rare, which I love but it was a little too rare for my girlfriend. So make sure to ask for well done if you don't like your meat pink.The fries were pretty damn good too!Overall it is better than the likes of ShakeShack but didn't blow my mind

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom. The 'Smokey Robinson' burger in all it's glory

AGLUaShGS6JN10-s_yjpEw.text: Best hamburger I've ever tasted! Good prices, pleasant staff.It can get very busy here!

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom. Smokey Robinson Burger

tHXw6Z78-wFg4yUs_92ttQ.text: My only official recommendations are US Army-issued mustache trimmers, Morton's Salt, and the burgers at Patty & Bun. Excellent.

jKdE3VNpTH-iVLoul7kGug.text: Queue moves quickly. Waited about 30 mins on a Sat afternoon. Had the smokey Robinson & Jose Jose chilli burger. Smokey had lovely sweet caramelised onions, smokey bacon and smokey mayo sauce. Jose had smoked cheese and delicious chilli relish that was like crack! Amazing homemade hot sauce too. The fries are good. The chicken wings were incredibly rich - too rich for me. Would be awesome if the did a buffalo version of them though. We'll go back, once I recover from my bypass surgery.

xY4VXUd6-h4O0xSfnekKtQ.text: One of - if not THE - best burgers in town. So juicy you won't know what to do with yourself. Good beers available, too. My only gripe is that they include an 'optional' service charge on your bill. How people are itching to be that asshole who says "I'd really prefer to not pay this extra 75p." I came close, honestly, but didn't want to be that guy. The burgers are already expensive (£7.50 for the most basic option), though. I don't know, optional - but included! - service charges just rub me the wrong way. Especially when the service is fairly nonchalant, which I'd say it was.

fWal3qhPZlN6zF1fB8nzEg.text: The burger is something we in the UK have tried to do for a while. A meat slab sandwiched between two buns purchased from Tesco, with a slice of lettuce, and an attempt to lather in cheese, have been evident for a while. Most commonly cited in the UK is the specialised "pub" burger, by the gastro centric local produce gatherer, and the pop up trendy huts that serve "honest food n that". Anyway, patty and bun came along, and confidently swiped aside pretence, and went for the classic hands down greasy tastefest that is the epitome of what  a really good burger should be like. One bite, and it's wolfed down. Its an addictive experience, governed by ones willingness to chase their own taste bud fulfillment levels. Go Try it see what you think. They are good, tasty, gritty, quality, and moreish. You know when food is really good, when you want another immediately after. And no.... They are not small... Go.

BYP7FH3eyx9jTn94pVJRGw.text: OMFG, this is most definitely theee best burger I have EVER had! hands down! Got take away for the whole office here today, we are all still in a burger dream land. Amazing!! Definitely tops alot of the other trendy burger places for sure! The burger was sooo juicy, flavorsome, messy, tasty, oh I could go on and on! The brioche bun was nice and light and so the whole burger didn't leave that heavy feeling you sometimes get in your stomach. I had the Chorizo chilli burger, my only gripe was that it had no spice kick whatsover. The relish was tasty and sweet, but there was no chilli kick ;-( The chips were really good too! Crispy skin on, nicely salted, couldn't really taste the rosemary but that didn't bother me. Prices are on the high side though. £2.50 is a bit much for chips. I mean, really, they are only fried potatoes....Although the price clearly does not put people off, there was a queue outside the place at 12:30pm today, and it was raining!If P&B keep up what they are doing so well for a bt longer, they can all retire in about 5 years!Overall, I will return once a month until I have sampled each burger off the menu!! (actually maybe sooner, like tomoza......) Defo recommmend!

Z4BstLi-rQ6X2kStpJU7TA.text: Just came back from a fairly unpleasant visit to say the least.When we were seated it took about 10 minutes to order. The tall brunette waitress got our order wrong (and I heard she got the order wrong on the table next to us aswell, a group of three guys who were charged 2 extra coke's they had ordered but she never brought out). After about 30 minutes she came out with one Ari Gold burger and one Chili-something burger and 2 fries, we ordered 2 Ari Golds. She apologized, what the heck, it happens I thought. After about 15 minutes the burger I ordered came out. She handled it very sloppy. When she handed it over to me, a few drips of burger juice landed on my shirt and lap, she didn't apologize, maybe she didn't see it, I don't know. The burger itself was a complete mess with no real structure., it fell apart after the first bite. I've lived in Chicago for a year and this burger is not even in my top 10. Personal preference but I don't like brioche buns at all, they are just to sweet. There were pickled onions on the burger to counter-act with the sweetness of the bun but far too little. The fries were great. She cleaned up our table and asked if everything was OK. I said "Can we get the bill please?" and she said sure. 10 minutes later, no bill. Then I asked one of the guys who worked there for the bill and I got it 30 seconds later.The guys who worked there were great. My brother Shazam:ed a song that was playing inside but didn't get a match. One of the guys saw it and went to the computer, got the name of the track and wrote it on a piece of paper and gave it to my brother. Very nice of him!

XsbBm0pHeco-_qHeq7I3Bg.text: My friends insisted I must have caught them on an off day but let's put it this way when you eat your food and think Why the heck am I wasting good money on this and can I get a refund then ya your food / consistency got issues.

nClyOoRNeZoe_4Hjun_1Pg.text: I got there at 11.45 on a Friday and there was barely any queue. Close to 12 there was a pretty big queue and people were coming to pick up phone orders.As soon as it opened I was seated quickly and ordered within a few minutes. My burger and wings came very very quickly. I guess I was one of the first to order.The wings were pretty good. Nice deep crunch and lovely and moist. The sauce was a little funky for my taste but overall they were nice.The burger was solid. I did feel the patty wasn't browned enough. It just didn't have that beautiful exterior crust us burger fiends love. It was beautifully moist though. Like ridiculously wet. I think the guys might need to tone down the fat ratio perhaps. I did feel it was slightly undercooked - for a medium rare it just felt too raw. The patty  wasn't salted enough. Just needed a tiny bit to give the beef a bit of a flavour boost - was a tad bland. The beefyness just wasn't there.Overall it was a good burger. I've eaten at all of the places in London and Lucky Chip absolutely blows it away.

440vGK44Nxb_Ki6oERvHfg.text: Best Burger I have had hands down. Amazing flavours. I had the Ari Gold. High recommended. Will be going back to try out the other burgers.

tS1hRyBXWe1mFBpFp7Bk4Q.text: Patty & Bun is right. Big, delicious burger patties with great brioche buns. The Smokey Robinson and the Ari Gold are both worth trying. The cheese sauce on the gold makes it my usual at this place. As a burger loving girl, this place (which was in walking distance of my flat - dangerous), was great. The patties are cooked perfectly, and the additions to the burgers are all good options. The rosemary chips were delicious and a great add to the burger greatness. The meal is usually about £10, which for a great burger in London, is about normal. Overall, one of my favorite burgers in London, and when I finally make it back there, I will go again. Be warned: the queue at lunch and dinner is LONG, but if you go at random times, it isn't too bad. It's also crowded seating, but it works with the atmosphere.

pOkKTLMdqeTyWrXSd0KoWw.text: The BEST BURGER ON THE PLANET is the Ari Gold at Patty & Bun. I've eaten hundreds of burgers in my lifetime and have been in pursuit of the perfect burger for some time. This burger is it. You'll see a long line outside of Patty & Bun and that's an indication that I'm not the only one who's discovered this secret. The Ari Gold features a perfectly cooked beef patty, gooey melted cheese, lettuce, tomato, pickled onions, ketchup, smokey P&B house-made mayo, and a brioche bun. Don't forget to throw on some tasty bacon to add that last bit of flavor heaven. The Ari is a melt in your mouth juicy, cheesy, salty, and tender masterpiece. The pillowy bun seems to melt with each bite and the ratio of the ingredients creates a perfect texture where none of them overpower the burger, while and all of them contribute to the flavor profile. The ingredients are well thought out, portioned appropriately, and are high quality. The trick to the Ari is the cheese + bun + beef all being perfect. Add on the bacon, smokey mayo, and the rest of the ingredients that are all amazing too and the Ari Gold takes the definition of 10 out of 10 and turns it up to 11. If you are in London you must go to Patty & Bun. The burger was so great that I couldn't believe it...so I had a second to confirm it was indeed the best burger on the planet.

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom. Ari Gold - Patty & Bun - photo by theburgerguidedotcom

Sk0NINV8GHvr1qYXRM-eXg.text: This place has great burgers. These are full-on greasy big ones and not for those looking for a light meal. The wings are a little too sweet for my tastes. Decent burgers, cool atmosphere, recommended!
