BH2alrh22fp3ZED2KW__Kw.text: Came here unexpectedly & wow amazing burgers. I had the Smokey Robinson, so tasty! Portions were big! The only negative is the hour long wait in the que other than that I highly recommend it!

8YYU9Uqtbg5B6n8gjd7Zkw.text: For what it's worth Patty and Bun is a great burger place. The burgers were nice and juicy while the chips were great as well. I waited for a table for 2 about 25 minutes on a Sunday evening around 7, which I thought was a bit much but the place is relatively small. The workers there were nice and friendly and overall the place has a great atmosphere. I must say if Meatliquor didn't exist this place might be my favourite burger place in London... but for now Patty and Bun will have to take second place!

7FPeIJ26fon0pJHjLRQvuA.text: One of the best burgers I've ever had. Perfectly smoky sauce, beautiful brioche bun and cow from the gods. Go!

drsc5yVxI4HhCncDSb012A.text: If you don't mind the staff shamelessly (possibly ironically) lip syncing to sam smith-tunes, this is an excellent spot. The place is usually packed to the brim, so expect a bit of a wait. The burgers are truly tasty deliciousness with lots and lots of flavour, but beware, they will betray your trust and make you look like a mess. A very decent meal!

K-TGNLEdC6iT_j3FkZMX8Q.text: Fantastic service and fantastic burgers! Best burgers we have had in London so far and also very we'll priced and the service was truly great! Highly recommended!

J-zm6qzKovrGMygCCwuOBw.text: Daaank. I would say that Patty & Bun differs from other burger places in their toppings. Toppings on toppings. Also the brioche bun is a great concept. I had the portobello mushroom "burger" and it was delicious. I would definitely come back here if I wasn't peacing out from London. So do me a favor, and check it out. Also, VAT isn't added in on the menu prices, so just be aware that things are a little more expensive than they seem.

QniIQT9GnOViOXW42pv0ug.text: So this place is just awesome.Visited with a couple of friends over the Easter bank holiday. I have a pet hate for this London 'we're a hip restaurant so you have to queue' craze, but we grabbed a couple of cans and had a laugh during our 45 minute wait. I had to take off a star because of this, everything else is straight 5s.The service is great and the burger is the best I have had in London. The patty is divine, the bun holds up... Have to admit we went double patty due some serious hunger... It was so worth the food coma. Also if you can, get the chicken wings, they are insane. Never before have I been able to 'Fred Flintstone' a wing... A dream realised.Can't recommend this place enough. Grab some bevvies for the queue and prepare yourself for burger heaven.

Ain0_ZlpJ7uEMj3M9A5F7Q.text: I was for a few days in London living just next door. I thought that I might have a burger to take away. The first time I came around 10pm. I was told that they were running out of food and they were favouring in-room clients, which is normal since they bring more revenue. I then came back twice (I was living next door) the next two days, every time earlier (at 6pm then at 4pm) and I was served the same excuse.  If they don't want to serve take away for whatever reason, they should say it and remove it from the menu/front of the store. Anyway, it's not like London is lacking good burgers at the moment.

mBu7N0kEfJ9DbVqYAkzrxw.text: Not a huge burger fan, but the Smokey Robinson was pretty good.  We shared the burger, fries, and the brisket filled tots.  Yes, a ton of food, but considering we slept in until 2:30p after a night of drinking we decided to combine breakfast and lunch.  The burger was a handful--super messy, but also really good.  The tots were cool to try, but I would have been fine without them.Service was friendly & welcoming!  I'd definitely go back to try other items on the menu.

UQefLk59BzlVG-hHnd84cQ.text: Stopped by with two other travelers for what I was told would be the best burger in London.  As I was only in town for the 1 night, I trusted the local source.  I enjoyed the Lamb-shank Redemption Burger, Chips, and some Slaw.  My burger was cooked Medium as ordered and very flavorful and juicy.  The serving of Chips was healthy and I found the very unique Slaw quite tasty.  If judging on food alone this would be a five star review.  The only reason for the downgrade has more to do with the ambiance, which I found rushed and distractingly to loud to hold even a friendly chat over dinner.  Will be back when I am in London and will try and sit outside.

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom

a726gdbY-GczH3OAvtyhsQ.text: My burger dripped all over my jeans and after a wash I can still see the stains. In that moment did I care? No. I was too busy enjoying the juicy lamb burger. Cooked medium with lovely thin fries. Prices are surprisingly reasonable for a place this hyped. Staff were friendly and service was quick. There was a short queue outside the door but they do their best to get groups in and out. Don't plan on hanging Long here but so give it a try. Just be sure to keep your burger and it's oozing goodness off your clothesWill be back to try the spicy chicken burger.

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom. Lamb Burger and Rosemary Salt Fries

WugyF4V8eu3gmaygXNLHJQ.text: My FAVOURITE burger in the UK so far! found it thanks to an article in the telegraph newspaper where it was ranked 1st of the world! I therefore made the most of a trip down to london to give it a go! and I'm glad I did!I got the smokey burger that was full of flavour and moist! the burger itself was cooked perfectly rare medium! chips were also nice (i already try better though but well only the burger has been elected)! the chicken mayonnaise was very tasty!the place is very small (can probably accomodate 20 people) so the wait can probably be quite long! but they also do take away!not sure if it's the best burger of the world but definitely one of my favourite!bad news for my diet though, I discovered that one of their 3 restaurants is located close to a place where I've regular meetings...

lxvU-6AkCluI9lZTSSmZdg.text: Prosecco & burgers. Not a bad combination :)Great service & and most importantly aaaamaaazing burgers

Glto-TeOpJNy0tw66NTBdw.text: Simply delicious. Good burger place. Very tasty and crunchy bacon. Only need to add some milkshakes to the menu. It's a simple recipe but it works. The only bad thing about the place is the size. It's really small and the music is too loud to talk. Good idea? Take out.

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom. Argo gold. It tastes way better than it looks.

wpvGZAjAV1wgSeCWSHIewQ.text: I totally admit it:  I kind of didn't want to bother coming here. I love Honest Burger, and their fries, and I don't need P&B being awesome and confusing the issue. That said, P&B had a few other things going against it from the outset. All the hype, for one. The wait, for two. It was cold, and we had to wait outside for a table. There were no heat lamps (I kind of find this one unforgivable - keep your fans comfortable, it's not so hard is it?). And you had to stand, in line formation, shuffling along as those in front were painstakingly slowly ushered inside to warm burger goodness.I was feeling especially fickle that night, so I begged my husband to jump ship. I was hungry, I didn't want to wait. Thankfully, the hostess was super-nice, and checked on us line people regularly, offering updates and generally making sure we didn't feel forgotten, fingers frozen, bellies empty. They also had a clever little sign out --"Risk it for the brisket" to advertise their special -- that made me smile despite my growing, hunger-fueled rage. And their menu is simple yet diverse (chicken wings, brisket, mushroom burger, etc).Finally, we were provided a table and shouted our order to the first person who came anywhere near us: the Ari Gold, medium well, and the Smokey Robinson, no mayo, med-rare, two rosemary chips, one coke. Now! Please! Yesterday!Thankfully it only took about 10 minutes for our food to show up -- no plates here, just a burger in a wrapper, and when I asked for extra ketchup it arrived real quick like. My burger was cooked correctly and so was my husband's -- a simple but important factor. I thought I would hate the brioche bun (you need some substance to a good burger bun) but it held up fine and did not introduce an odd taste into the mix (as I thought it would). I didn't love it either, though. I don't find it to be a game changer for burgers, and I don't view it as the selling point so many others seem to.So, their onions are pickled and their smoky P&B mayo incorporates BBQ sauce, together giving the overpowering flavor of tangy vinegar. Personally, I really, really didn't like it. They do have regular mayo so if you're like me, I'm sure you can sub the P&B version for regular. My final conclusion is that I'm glad I stuck it out in the end, but I wouldn't do that wait again.

dnjUNw4v44QGevVtI76JFA.text: Food was not great, but even worse than that was the service. They will make you wait outside even with empty tables if you're party isn't there yet! I can understand if it is during peak timings, but this happened on a dead night. Burger was nothing to write home about- average. Greasy, too.

FC7Tyvyx2XXBIJot6gO3kg.text: Yummy burgers which took london by storm! The hype has died down a bit but the quality definitely hasn't.

KCfPHAykf5645TO9XC5n4Q.text: Best burgers in London. (The only downside is the music. I've been twice and it's so loud it's hard to talk)

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom

2LThrxePyh3AxN4mFV6o6A.text: The Marleybone is hookin' it up.They made a cheeseburger without a patty for me. That's gangsta. The melted cheese, smokey sauce, lettuce, tomato and pickle, all tied together nicely, on a toasted brioche bun. The fries were crispy and flavorful. The vibe was fresh without trying too hard. Clubby music, without being obnoxious. Nice wait staff, fast service, and some badass lil' hot sauce to set things off. Legit.

Gr6MKj0bRnmdfjgx_bLbrA.text: Says it closes at 11pm (23:00), show up at 10:15 (22:15) to be told kitchen is closed. Not worth the trip, if you stop your primary business 45 minutes before your posted closing time, change your posted closing time so you don't waste our time. Failure of service, business, entrepreneurship, and capitalism. Thumbs down.

dC6VGPijNQl_7VL27sYZuQ.text: We came here on a Thursday evening and had to queue for about a half hour... So beware if you plan on coming on a weekend, as I imagine the wait would be much longer.I had the Smokey Robinson and it was really good... but it was SO SO messy. Definitely not a first date kind of place.I didn't like the fact that tableware and silverware were non-existent. I'm sure it's meant to add to the charm, but it just ends up being very inconvenient since the burger can get pretty sloppy.Overall, I would prefer Honest Burger, but if you're in the area I would give Patty & Bun a try.

lMlBTUPEEU01c1ZTBC0xog.text: One of my favourite burger place in London. Careful though, they are quite juicy and it didn't work very well with my white pants. Also, there is not many tables and you cannot book, be prepared to wait or try to go outside of peak.

F1AHTO0nxJvC44anewFQ1Q.text: I stopped in here before the FA Cup semi-final and so that may have coloured my experience (I was in a great mood!) but really this is a good place.   The burgers and particularly the fries were decadent and tasty.   The only complaint is that they didn't have enough good beers on tap and it was very crowded.

mQa2sgQrQ1a73FYGgGtfjQ.text: My husband and I were walking around the neighborhood on a Saturday afternoon trying to figure out what to eat for lunch.  We walked past Patty and Bun and saw there was no queue and took advantage of the situation because there's ALWAYS a queue.Food: We ordered the "Ari Gold Cheeseburger" which is their traditional burger and two orders of chips.  I'm looking forward to trying their other burgers.  One awesome surprise was their hot sauce.  It was a smokey hot sauce which was delish!Drinks: We ordered two soft drinks.Price: For two people we paid 25.85 GBP.Ambiance: The place is small (31 seats) which is why there's always a queue outside.  The tables/chairs are tight, but once you get seated you don't care because the smells of the burger and fries are to die for.  The restaurant is lively, everyone is young and the music is good.Service: The service was great.  The host was super friendly and our server was very nice.  The food comes out pretty quickly.Would I go back?  Definitely!  It's on the favorites list in the neighborhood.  Not sure how long I would queue for it, but if you're walking by and there's no queue definitely see it as a sign from the universe that you must eat a burger!

r6hkDqD7szPrLX5VVhlmng.text: I  generally not an eat out burger guy, but this place was great. It is a small hole in the wall place, so not a lot of seating. The burger was amazing though and the ladies serving were very nice.

ZY04QFWGWZA1ut5DbBHXcA.text: Having started out as a pop up burger bar, Patty and Bun have fast become one of the best burger diners in London, demonstrated by the queues outside. Our 30min wait wasn't too onerous and we soon headed into the small 30 seater restaurant to pick from a simple yet mouth watering menu.There's no plates, just paper cups for chips and paper bowls for coleslaw. The simplicity of it means that there is a fast turn around yet we didn't feel like we'd been rushed in and out. Sauce was all over the wrapper on my "Smokey Robinson" burger and it was really tasty, bacon, caramelised onions, a burger patty that was just pink enough in the middle surrounded by a brioche bun, mmm.The atmosphere was really laid back, tunes were pumping out of a laptop and the rosemary skin on chips were devine. I've read that the ingredients are British where they can be (which is great), so there was no doubt why people were queuing down the road for a table in this simple yet delightful burger joint on James Street. Oh and they do takeaway!

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom. The smokey Robinson
Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom. Mm chips

EWDs9B1GsmwfBPRf9rzf6w.text: One piece of advice for Patty & Bun - get there for when it opens. The line down the street is completely justified due to their amazing burgers, but builds up quickly and if you don't want a wait, you need to get there on the dot of opening.   They add a nice twist to classic burgers - the fried chicken burger is my favorite out of most other places I've visited - while nothing is crazy out of the ordinary, they take the classics and do them well.

RdxE9XDnMr2EaHn84pLJsw.text: I had been waiting to visit Patty & Bun for AGES. I'm serious, ages. I had heard from reputable sources that they might well be the best burgers in the city. Big talk, I know. So I showed up with my sister for a work lunchtime and it was a good thing she had been in the queue before 12pm because it was already half-way down the block. We sat and quickly chose the chicken burger each and fries to share. It's not a cheap burger, by the way, it'll cost you. They came out wrapped in paper, no plates, and looked messy and delicious. And it was so so good. But jesus, the garlic sauce regret that followed. I've never smelled so badly or burped so much garlic in my life. I'm surprised I still can't taste it months later or that anyone in my office still agrees to be sat near me. For the love of God, avoid ordering anything with the garlic mayo on it here.

WrJwlAWojRugJDunTACtyw.text: Hands down one of the best burgers I've had. These are flavoursome, juicy and so melt in your mouth.The bun is fantastic, the meat succulent and delicious.My favourite is the Ari Gold (which has won awards) - it's finger smacking great! Somehow the ingredients just balance perfectly - plus I am completely in love with the sauce!The reason why this isn't a higher score - the price. In two mouthfuls these burgers are gone... and at £7.50+ per burger (and that's the going price without chips), I was left wanting more and feeling rather empty.The restaurant itself has a great atmosphere, but it also tends to have a long queue, which is a pain!

cte3LAnnfpUbTbYDvJWN0A.text: Decent burger definitely not the best. Was a little disappointed after reading all the rave reviews. I ordered the Ari Gold (medium) and although it was pink it was dry. The flavor was just fine nothing amazing. Fries were good too. Definitely wouldn't return here.

jLjJ1hNTMc5G6_T0C12z-g.text: Excellent burgers!!! Courteous service... The only negative is that the Music was to loud for such a small place,

3Q29f1IYTnOhSV33qO97jQ.text: Great burgers! Compensate for the very loud music in the place. Honest price! The mayois good, but could be better.

0XN6TwYZHC-O93IdWluGFA.text: I'm not sure if it's worth the wait at this location because it's just such a small restaurant, but the one on Frith street might be worth it, or near Liverpool street..or go for lunch!The burgers are amazing! i have been like 5 times but I always just get the lamb burger, because it's my favorite burger of all time. It's the only one in london that I can think of with that combination of flavors--feta cheese, pickled aubergine/eggplant, cumin aioli, and fried courgette/zuchini!

fRF201IBdxbR7rHtthmUaA.text: I absolutely love Patty & Bun.  I've had it a few times now, and it's still the only burger place which I get some serious cravings for. The meat is juicy and the brioche bun is undoubtedly the supporting star. I know some people find it a bit much, but I personally like that it is just a little on the sweet side and gives a bit more depth to the overall flavor of the burger. The rosemary fries cost extra but you will regret not getting them. They are slightly crispy, hot and don't even need the sauce which you can get with it. Queues can get long in the evenings, but their takeaway service is prompt and you still end up with a delicious burger.

honGXTD2jIL1Uqq1FHKG9w.text: A bold claim, but this is the best burger in London.Juicy, flavoursome and 100% in the category of dirty burger! My favourite is the Jose Jose Chilli burger, it's all of the above with a nice kick to it. Combine it with some Chips, and get yourself a side of Chicken which is also amazing! Then you have yourself a meal. The restaurant is small and can be quite loud, if you don't like that-make the sacrifice as the food will be worth it.I guarantee you will leave wanting to come back.Top 3 tips for this place-1.Get the chicken wings on the side, the burgers are not massive so the side will make sure you are full up!2.Be prepared to get messy...this is the ultimate dirty burger!3.The only thing I wouldn't bother with is the chicken skin salt

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom. Patty & Bun-James Street

aok0ahjjQDjlCp9vdwUZIg.text: One of my favourite burger place in London (and I have tried a couple of places here). This place do not take reservation and there is always a line outside. On a typical weekday it takes around 20mins wait.. which of course it's totally worth it! We ordered Smokey Robinson, chips with rosemary salts and their home made grapefruit & line soda. The bun is warm and lightly toasted, the beef cooked just right (I ordered medium) and it's very juicy. Together with the smokey bacon, melted cheese and caramelised onion, it's everything that you want from a burger. I will definitely return!

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom. Grapefruit & Lime soda, Smokey Robinson, chips with Rosemary Salt
Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom. Smokey Robinson, chips with rosemary salt

ynJy0KIC9YU4GKtWMNMrPg.text: The food is amazing, but the music so loud I couldn't hear my fiancé across the table. Speaking of tables, they are so close together I risked touching my rear end to our neighbors food just to get into my seat! Other than these 2 things, Patty & Bun is a must! Their menu is small, but that's because they do these things well.The burgers come out in a parchment paper wrapper - no plates, no nonsense. It's messy and delicious. We tried the Ari Gold cheeseburger and the Smokey Robinson, both I would highly recommend. The chips with roast chicken mayo and chicken skin salt were fantastic. They were salty and crispy and a great balance to the savory of the burger. This place is definitely worth seeking out!

xW04ZZ1N-jpUhlEEhQWzfw.text: I'm gonna go ahead and say it, this is my favourite burger in London. There!I love Patty and Bun and I don't go there often enough... The atmosphere is a real London feel, good London music intertwined with some classic soul, R&B and hip-hop is a good start for me. It's a little hipster, but somehow manages to also be no-nonsense.The burgers are dirty by design, no haute cuisine silliness here. The cheese oozes, the sauce drips, and the patty tastes good! I usually go for the Smokey Robinson (BBQ goodness), but the Ari Gold is a good option as well. My secret to never being disappointed is not ordering fries with my burger and getting the melt in your mouth, absolutely beautiful Winger Winger Chicken Dinner wings as a side instead. It works, trust me!!Good selection of drinks including ones you may not find everywhere (like Ting).Small menu, but it's all you need for a burger joint.

AyPBvLKVUXcR3L6yTMcBsQ.text: I really enjoyed Patty & Bun and to this day, I think it is one of the best lamb burgers I think I have ever tasted.We got there early as we had tried to go previously however the queue was pretty long. This time that we went, we got there for 5pm so it was still fairly early. We were seated straight away and after about 5-10 mins we had ordered. (I think it helped that I researched the menu beforehand)! Both of us ordered the Lambshank Redemption burger (cleverly named) and shared a portion of sweet potato fries. The food came on a tray with the burger wrapped in paper (reminiscent of a fast food restaurant) which said 'Bite Me' on the inside which I thought was quite cute. The lamb burger was divine. Not too greasy and melted in your mouth. The sweet potato fries were well seasoned and were not that greasy either. Before going to Patty & Bun, and seeing the queue, I was wondering what all the fuss was about. However after eating there and having such a good meal I was pleasantly surprised and also I understood the hype! It is a small restaurant however the food is great as is the service and I would definitely recommend visiting if you are in the area!

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom. The Lambshank Redemption burger

gQ2nNaXxfNrPS8MxS0uIUA.text: Cool music. Cool decor. Great burgers. Quite pleased with the lamb burger. Fries were perfect.

OIhfO1loJ2-icpfWkK4big.text: I have never known a love like my love for Patty & Bun. Patty & Bun is everything every burger joint in the world wishes it could be. It's casual, quick and delicious. I will never understand why people choose to go to Shake Shack when they could be dining at London's very own Patty & Bun. Alright guys and girls, it's not a particularly elegant affair. It's hands on. It's going to be messy. You are probably going to need to be garden hosed after eating here but it's worth every little bit of hassle. The Ari Gold burger is the one I always go for. Rosemary fries plus coleslaw on the side and, if I'm feeling extra hungry or generous with my cash, THUNDER THIGHS!I've never had to queue at this place but I have walked past when there are queues and let me tell you... there are sometimes people waiting down the street 3 or 4 doors down trying to get a table here. So plan accordingly if you don't have the luxury of queueing for an hour.I do wish they had a better drink selection. Shakes would be a great addition to the menu and for some reason, the beer of choice here is Red Stripe. Oh well. I suppose nothing is perfect so all things considered, it's a small price to pay.

6tbBMFkSypv0EVM0lDvQxA.text: Fan fricking tastic! The vibe, the service... The burgers! Unbelievable. Try the chicken spice fries with roast chicken mayo and Netflix&Chilli burger if it's still available.We got there late on a Friday night (21.45) so didn't queue at all.Happy, full bellied customers. We will definitely be back! Nom.

kQbQ2JF-v4yPaT-PFX_hhw.text: I wanted to try one of Londons best burger places, and had read various reviews trying to figure out which to visit. I have previously eaten at MeatLiquor and Lucky Chip, favouring the latter. Naturally, I had very high expectations for Patty and Bun and my expectations were further encouraged by the long queue outside. We were there on a Thursday night around 9pm, and had to queue 50 minutes before getting a table. The staff were not particularly efficient in keeping tables occupied, and several tables were empty for a full 20 minutes before we were seated (considering that this place serves all its food in disposable serveware, this seems unnecessary).I ordered the Jose Jose burger, which is the same as the signature Ari Gold cheeseburger, with the addition of a chili chorizo sauce. We also ordered chips with chicken skin mayo. My burger was cooked perfectly ( I asked for medium rare), but the meat itself wasn't particularly flavourful. While the texture of the burger was very good, I am sad to report that none of the different burger components tasted as much as I had hoped. Also, the burger was definitely on the greasy side - to the point where it became difficult to eat without it falling apart. I agree that a good burger should be greasy, but this was excessive.I had hoped for much more from Patty and Bun, and can sadly not join in with the reviews proclaiming this London's best burger :(

DqzzMAilMy0vw99hCDLyuw.text: Juicy and tasty  patties! Best eaten medium .The fries is hot and fresh with touch of rosemary.However, the wings are not good ( just skip it in the menu). Expect a wait of 15-20 minutes as the resturant very busy!!

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom

Yk9FUGABl_kp5C41712fqA.text: Hey you sexy little better burger bar...I love your style.  Your laser focused menu keeps it real and your veggie portobello burger was super duper.  Love that you have wine and beer and you embraced my kids.  25 minute wait was worth it.  Hipsters abound but only two beards in sight.

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom

VVStkdnTeJzptrsF-XKehg.text: Messy, heart-stopping, mouth orgasming goodness. We'd the 'Ary Gold Burger, the Smokey Robinson Burger, and Chips. Get there before last orders- 45mins before closing, the chefs will not even entertain the idea of your order, which you have to respect given how busy it is constantly. + All three burger patties were juicy and perfectly medium (you are asked your preference), which frankly some larger places just seem to fail at. Brioche buns were fresh and not dry or oiley. The only criticism was the Smokey Robinson wasn't smokey, and I think it's purely because it's drowning in everything else. In fact the 'Ary Gold was smokier, and also finger-licking good. - Too messy. BUT they give a searingly citrusy moist towelette at the end of the meal which cleans it all right off. Get your fingers in there! (Definitely an interesting date moment).+ Chips/fries were delicious, and home cut from actual potatoes (could see the skin) and tossed in delicious Rosemary salt seasoning. + Their own P&B mayo is delicious.+ Get a Wray n Ting, or grab a nice small bottle of Red Stripe to cleanse your palette.Special: 'Get the Duck Out'; brioche bun, beef burger patty, crispy duck, apple & coriander slaw. Something something tasty..Approx £15 each for burger, chips and drink. Good value considering many places in London would give you a far less superior burger alone.

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom. Two Jose Jose Burgers, chips, wings & ginger ale rums.

vvev861zA81pk7GluKMddw.text: This burger joint definitely lived up to the hype, well worth the 10 min wait.  Staff was casual but courteous, on point the whole time and accommodating my wife's veggie-ness.  I had the Smokey Robinson burger, done just a touch under medium so it's pink and tender but quite rich in flavor with each bite.  The caramelized onions and smokey mayo definitely conspire well with the molten cheddar to make for a decadent creation.  The fries were quite good too, especially with their house hot sauce.  All in all, pretty perfect affair.

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom. Smokey Robinson Burger

qErHjBjhw0EuJeJ9weg-ow.text: Ok, ok, I know I am waaaay behind the trend for queuing at hyped-up burger places in London. I just never think it'll be worth it, or more likely I'm always just too hungry to wait, or even more likely for the UK the weather is just too miserable to stand outside in. But finally the fates conspired to bless me with an early escape from work AND nice weather for queuing AND a non-veggie mate to catch up with (there is a mushroom-based veg option here, but burgers just aren't my veggie friends' first choice plus the ones that don't like mushrooms would be pretty screwed).My mate got there first and promptly messaged me to say the queue would take 45mins and the guy on the door was a hottie - clearly 2 vital pieces of information, both of which helped us decide to stick it out and wait ;)As it turned out, she was right about the hottie but the queue was closer to an hour long and seemed to move in shifts, i.e. every 20mins they'd seat 3 or 4 tables at the same time. With lots to catch up on we barely noticed the time pass, though it'd probably be a different story if the earlier monsoon was still going.We got the table closest to the window, so those still queuing could press their noses up against the glass to stare at our food. With the compact menu on display outside we'd long since made up our minds and a very friendly waitress was happy to take our order right away.By now the anticipation had surely built to mouth-wateringly unattainable levels, right?! But shockeroo - I think this burger damn well lived up to the hype! I went for the Smokey Robinson which was a glorious mess of beef patty plus cheese, lettuce, tomato, yummy smokey secret recipe mayo and caramelised onions (which is what swung it for me) in a surprisingly tasty brioche bun. Ok it comes with bacon too but I err donated that to my mate (so shoot me - I'm just not a bacon fan!).Otherwise I loved every last sauce-dripping-down-your-fingers/hand/forearms bit of it - prepare to get stuck in as there's just no clean way of eating these, which they seem to acknowledge by giving you a stack of napkins and your burger in greaseproof paper instead of a plate. Slightly embarrassing when the waitress comes over to check on you and sees what a mess you've made but hey ho. Defo get the side of chips too - in our token attempt to be good we shared one and the rosemary salt is a winner.The place is cute and compact with cheeky cardboard signs dotted about - but you don't really notice this until your post-queuing single-minded focus on getting a burger inside you is satisfied. It's pricey but not crazy for what you get, so I'll be back the next time my greasy burger cravings hit if I can get there early enough - so naughty but sooo good!!

eJJvR-2iOCcbP2sJVL_Usg.text: This place is on point, friendly service and outstanding food. We had the boneless chicken wings yum then the traditional cheeseburger one of the best burgers I've ever had. Will definitely be back before I head home.

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom

GyeG-3UwUutHPz6dNVtRYw.text: Nice staff, fast service, good sound track, low prices.Everything was good except the meat between the buns.Why? Burger is preformed and pre-frozen which results in a dryer, tougher, and way less juicy and flavorful eating experience. Basically the burger was only slightly less tough and chewy than rubber. Also served medium well, not medium rare as ordered. UPDATE: I have been told that the burgers at P&B are not frozen. Fair enough, but this does change the essential flavorlessness and toughness of the patty.Fresh ground beef would undoubtedly raise the experience at Patty and Bun, but also increase the price and time to prepare, which would of course raise the price to the customer.A higher price point could well diminish the appeal to the teens and early 20's crowd that make up the majority of the Patty and Bun customers, and this obviously would be bad for the owners, and presumably their families.

VuVjEOtKwSIAsspFNTGQXA.text: Went here for quick dinner one work night. The restaurant is cute and the service was fantastic - no fault there. Food - had one of their beef burgers which was very tender and juicy. Their buttermilk chicken burger wasn't too great (wouldn't get it again). To note: you pay extra for fries .Would I go again: For their beef burger yes, but if I want a buttermilk chicken burger I'd go for Butchies.

NIixe9UvbknyhxYjlG445A.text: The Ari Gold is one hell of a messy burger... and I like it! There is so much cheese, meat juice, and sauce that oozes out of the burger when you bite down on it. Luckily, you have that delicious brioche bun to absorb all the fatty goodness while holding everything together. I also enjoyed how the tartness of the pickled onions was quite prominent, helping round out the overall flavor profile. Next time, I'd like to give the Smokey Robinson a shot.

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom. "ARI GOLD" Cheeseburger (8.50) - beef patty, cheese, lettuce, tomato, pickled onions, ketchup, smokey P&B mayo, brioche

L0ZqQEWH3Mz1NH4OHeQeoQ.text: Sorry but I don't get why there's all the love for this place.  I may be spoiled by burgers and chicken sandwiches  in NYC or maybe it's just a matter of taste but .... the burger and the fried chicken are almost entirely flavorless.  No seasoning was apparent at all. I've never tasted fried chicken that tasted of almost nothing but here I wondered ... is this chicken? Is it fish? And the burger patty (they "recommend medium well" to which I agreed only to receive medium rare) similarly ... the toppings are doing ALL the work here but the fundamentals are flawed. A question that this visit to London prompted: why consume bland, tasteless fried food? If you are going down that unhealthy road don't you want the pleasure of flavor?

XGeZyNk7Z8ps_zNR6nGI8w.text: As usual busy (which is a good thing) got their Ari Gold burger, delicious as always.  Order the Chipotle Coleslaw, you won't be disappointed.  The wings were not as good.

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom

L3qcMh45xqsUyQo3sK2ahw.text: A local overheard us talking about In-N-Out, which he happened to try in San Francisco. He recommended that we try Patty & Bun, so we hopped on the tube and ran to make it before closing. This random occurrence turned out to be one of the most satisfying decisions on our London trip. The burgers were juicy and cooked to perfection (we ordered them medium rare). The flavors were amazing.  The price was yet another plus to this burger. It was quite a deal for such a quality restaurant burger. I've had more expensive burgers that don't come close in comparison. The flavors were what you would expect from a $15-20 burger. Also, there's spirits! I was excited about this since I'm more of a fan of these than the usual beer, wine, and rosé.The atmosphere was also unique, with great music and dim lights. If you aren't a fan of noisier establishments or have small children, don't miss out and order takeaway. I know the loud music is not for everyone, but I loved it and highly recommend it.

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom. Cranberry vodka
Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom. Ari gold, it was delicious!
Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom

NbuQM3BT26weaCS4Yw2dGA.text: Keep it simple and order the Ari Gold medium rare and chips. Surprised this is a chain, their burgers are off the hook! Extra points for taking my takeaway order with FOUR minutes left to close (was coming straight from the airport and starvin').

JFRL5isM5g9hGEkqPpsi-A.text: Pretty cool little spot. The service and atmosphere was really great! 3/3 for that alone! I had the fried chicken burger which was a bit flavorless and bland. The batter was really crispy which I did like, but I didn't order a batter burger with coleslaw and pickles; and that's what it tasted like I was eating.

efkUqJeA2UyQjGXxoJjX7w.text: Freakin awesome! Found my way with the help of yelp... and it was soooo good! Easily the best choice if you're shopping in Oxford St and want something non-chainy and delish!

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom

sgpE6Jx1PVtZLNUyQ4SQyw.text: The best burger in town ! It doesn't get any better ! Que and wait ! Trust me it's worth it ! I am an athlete and I had to eat there twice

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom

-rfYYDoRVoOT2XbLSI96jw.text: I wish I remembered my server's name because she was lovely. This is a snug little restaurant that can probably fit only 20-25 people but man the burgers are delicious! I picked Patty and Bun to celebrate my last meal in the city, and I'm glad I did so! Went here on a Sunday evening, the restaurant is hidden in a corner off of Oxford street and can be a little hard to find, especially because it does not have a big sign. I think there was little bit of a wait but because I was by myself they were able to seat me right away. You order burger and fries separately- which is kind of a bummer (fries and burger are married, one shouldn't have to order them separately). I ordered the mushroom burger and fries. My order took a little longer than normal to come out, but when it did it made me very happy. They have a special house spicy sauce which I thought was delicious too.

kVZkzsV6az6uYE7UypA92Q.text: The burger was OK but not so much impressive and burger is wrapped with paper not comes on a plate - you would imagine how mess it's going to be.  Burgers are much better in US rather than UK. The good thing is that they will provide wet tissue with lemon scent after bill to wipe off all the sauces stick to your hands.

WKPtVG-cEk13iJJXsSxDRQ.text: Wow. This place is just incredible. I went here on the recommendation of a friend in London, and was just blown away. The burger I got was a "monthly special" and it was just amazing. The patties were juicy and flavorful, and the fried onions were a perfect addition. The fries were wonderful, and the cheese balls with xxx sauce were a fantastic opener. Seriously, the xxx sauce is something special. Even if this place is out of your way, I'd recommend going. This might be one of the best burgers I've had not only in the UK, but in the world.

f5mupU1PVBXJGN3n3pPAPw.text: Great Patty bun!Veggie burger is with a big mushroom, not nice for me, but my colleagues enjoyed to much!The best was chip potato with Rosemarie... Lovely!!

aqZBZ5ZlncejB7yvqRV88g.text: I'm a burger gal, but at this joint, I think I liked the chicken burger way better.  It was meaty and had all the right elements to make it feel like the better option.  While the burgers had all the necessary toppings, maybe the brioche type bun over did the flavor.  Maybe the bun was too thick for my liking?  I'm not sure.  I tried the Smokey Robinson, but it wasn't too special for me.  The rosemary salt fries/chips were addicting, most especially with the mayo dipping sauce.This place is good for London, but in my opinion, it's pricey.  The initial prices aren't too bad, but everything is additional - fries, sauce, etc.  If they have a meal deal special option during a happy hour or something, I think it would be worth it.  Otherwise, choose to satisfy your burger craving wisely.

OG2iwd6xaJdfmMCJ7Q519Q.text: Lovely burgers and nice atmosphere.The Music was at little bit loud but its was okay. :-)The prices are fine and low, but you need to pay extra for fries and dip. :-/Over all a nice "burger-date".

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom

EMvZJQ8g8eo3Y0TCi00wNg.text: Went here with a few friends from work on bfs recommendation - he raves about their burgers and goes once a month at lunch time at the Liverpool Street branchThey don't take bookings and are a bit funny about seating until the whole group are there  (we were waiting for one person), which I do understand if it's busy but there were a few tables free but instead had to wait in cold (not enough room inside)Menu is small but looks goodI went with the smoky Robinson and got to try my friends lamb burgerBoth were good but not amaaaazingI prefer shake shack! Also service a bit rushed and waiters not greatProbably would get one for lunch if walking past but wouldn't go back for dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom

DJZd-6R0uGS6joTHhiGbRQ.text: I visited the James Street branch and had a Smokey Robinson to go. My order was taken right away by a very nice waiter and came out very quickly, I was given water while I waited. The meat was cooked a perfect medium rare as I had ordered and the burger was really nice, I particularly liked the caramelised onions. The bun did get a little soggy but that's to be expected with all the great juices from the patty.I'll definitely be back for more and will give the fries a try as apparently they are some of the best in London.

B01riON1bzUniO8AVR_pTw.text: Truly loved this tiny little burger place!! the burgers were super juicy and tasty and the fries were crispy and a perfect compliment. it's the perfect place to enjoy a meal after touring around all day.   we went there over and over again while we were in London and have missed it since!

Hf1Y42rh9BBUi5HMV8Jgbg.text: It's pretty good, Patty & Bun. First good sign was that it was packed - but though we went in the thick of weekday lunch rush, we only had to wait about 10 minutes for the three of us to be seated.  Quick turnover, ftw!Second good sign was that the veggie portobello burger is described to come with a plethora of fixin's, including but not limited to: *draws breath and clears throat* garlic parsley butter cheese slaw buttermilk baby courgette pickled onions tarragon mayo lettuce. Phew! A lot of stuff. All good sounding stuff, too. The problem with having a lot of stuff is that there is a lot of slidey, slippery mess involved in the burger-eating process. While I'm no stranger to creamy white stuff dribbling on my chin (yep, I went there), I'd prefer to be free of it while eating a meal in public. Also, 'a lot of stuff' meant a lot of flavours, and whether they complemented one another, I will never know. It was just a very overwhelming experience for my little tastebuds. Lastly, we got rosemary chips and coleslaw, which were both delicious, but separate from the burger price. In what world did this become okay??As other people have mentioned, the place itself is kitsch and cute - weird drawings on the walls, wax paper wrapped burgers with no plates on the table, sauces in a big sharing caddy at the front, etc. Fast food meets proper meal (because let's face it, you're still paying a tenner or more).3.5 stars to you, Patty & Bun. You go, P&B.

3bMEeZNlI7dK-hNPzH_ZeQ.text: Very good burgers and awesome music. A bit bummed they didn't have milkshakes.

rnRzVFf6si-5gW_lhChiOw.text: Patty & Bun. I dream that one day I'll come up with a suitably witty name for a business and then hopefully be able to provide a burger as good as these guys.P&B are a bit hard to find and typically go for a pop-up run at a cool pub or bar. I was lucky enough to find them at Feast last month which excited me to no end. For Feast, they offered up two choices: The Ari Gold and the Smokey Robinson. I had to go for the smoky option and was definitely not disappointed.The Smokey Robinson is a masterpiece boasting a beef patty topped with cheese, tomato, lettuce, "mounds of caramelised onions", bacon, ketchup, and smokey P&B mayo all piled onto a brioche bun. That's a whole lot of toppings and makes for a monster burger when you consider the patty itself is in the region of a  to 1/3 of a pound.It's simply delicious. The top-quality beef burger provides a full meaty flavour that fills your mouth and rolls seductively over your tongue. The sharp salty notes of the bacon and the sweetness of the onions leave you salivating for the next bite and the smokey P&B adds that woody, fresh off the grill, taste that is one of best spices for meat nature ever created. The brioche bun functions perfectly to trap any escaping juices and has enough starchy strength to hold together to the last bite.It took an incredible force of will to share with Tracy L and my mouth still waters to this day for my next P&B burger. Perhaps I'll track them down in their new home (wherever it may be) to sample some of the other burgers, particularly the chilli burger "Jose".

By2paU-aj-QUlfzfIkdbBQ.text: Amazing place and food. We tried their Ari Gold burger, fries, and chicken wings. The burger was so good that we ordered one more! Their fries is similar to five guys and their chicken wings is one of the best I tried. The place is small, we went their on Saturday evening and we waited about 40 minutes! But it was worth it. I like the atmosphere, they play loud music and the place is so trendy and full of young people.

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom. Our Bill

IUZyBooXWsEO1_g52GjeWw.text: It felt like my life direction had changed after eating this burger. I've since felt a loss purpose in life since I was just a tourist when I ate this burger and it is just so out of my reach now. So far away. Lost forever. I hate you Patty & Bun, until the time comes and we are reunited once more.

0VmCYnqdmnMmRhB2c6krJA.text: Best burgers in town!!! I had the chicken burger and it was so juicy and moist. The rosemary fries were really good too. Definitely high up on my list of recommendations

V-1stMd4mPgsmagJiiHdfw.text: I went here as it was rated London's #1 burger on one of the thousands of links that gets sent around facebook. I don't disagree. The burger was really really good! Not too much, not too little, yummy sides and sauces... On the downside, you can't book so stand outside for unestimateable periods of time (not fun if it's cold) with no bar to keep you entertained. Then when you get inside you're sandwiched shoulder to shoulder between everyone else, and can barely hear yourself think (yes I know I sound like an OAP but it was really unnecessarily loud!) due to the very heavy thumping music. Don't get me wrong, the food was worth a try, but the rest is more of a 'novelty'. Il be getting a take away next time a friend suggests Patty & Bun.

4ceYNxlI8CGSUTZo5DdFkw.text: I serendipitously came here at around 2pm on a weekday, after I had done some birthday shopping for my wife.  It was one of my Yelp bookmarks, so I was pleased with the find.Obviously, there were no tables free (and even a short queue outside) as this is a popular place.  The trick to beat the wait for a table is just to order a takeaway.  After all, at these places, it's the burger itself which is most important, not where you eat it. I got the Ari Gold cheeseburger which is delicious.  The beef patty was thick and juicy and the P&B mayo sauce was moreish.  I waited until I had a seat on the platform for the Jubilee line and it was worth it to miss the tube while I was tucking into my burger.I will definitely go back there and try another burger from the range.  Obviously, I will be taking my wife next time as she inevitably found out that I had sneakily gone there without her!

e25sTA98z4ee0-r1jAMrzA.text: I'm still craving their hamburgers. Hands down the best hamburger I have ever had, and when I visit London again, I will have to stop here multiple times. I inhaled my burger within a few minutes and still wanted more.If you want a classic burger, go for the Ari Gold, but if you want something sweeter, try the Smokey Robinson. Personally, I think the Ari Gold is more savory and much better. Seriously salivating right now. Be sure to get the chips as well, they are perfect.Luckily my friend and I got there before the rush, but it would be worth waiting for. It's a great place to go on a date, but your plate will definitely get messy!

Zo-KRxOwj36_BK29Y8Km2A.text: This place is amazing and we are burger snobs!! The burgers were INCREDIBLE and the wings as described by the waitress were "to die for", she was MORE than right! They were fall off the bone and so tasty. The staff was FANTASTIC, so friendly and attentive, which is rare in London. We arrived at 5:15 on a Friday night and still had to wait 35 minutes for a table - but SO worth it. I have two young kids and even on a Friday night were welcomed.

gmT9xMhd6I4M9ZDuUtgXdQ.text: Hrm!Pretty good, a bit pricier than I think it was worth (8 pounds +the added vat on top is a bit overkill..especially with no sides) but the burger was tasty. I had the Jose Jose. Problems? A bit too messy and lacking in texture..all the ingredients were a bit too soft in my book. Furthermore, I think the messiness of the burger kinda misses the point of a good "Patty and Bun" so to speak; the meat was good but I could barely taste it because there was so much other stuff going on in dem bunz.Not bad.p.s. the wings are a treat!

SYiLG4zDASt6ec7aUs8j5w.text: Great burgers, they defiantly have creativity! Had fries to but not necessary! Only down fall is the que that can form out side, wasnt a long wait through and was defiantly worth it

g6jLwjjL2ZNQqqg0qrS4gA.text: Gimme an Ari Gold or a Jose Jose and I'll be happy the whole week. Don't worry if you have to queue, it's worthy soooo much.

2zh1OGIAyG7pPYuBnYzU9Q.text: Quite simply the best burger I have ever eaten. I'd recommend the Ari Gold or if you can time it right you may get to experience the Rueben. I had both and neither disappointed. Service was very good and ensured that the wait outside wasn't too long. The only thing I could fault would be the rosemary fries. None of our group got much rosemary flavour but that doesn't mean they weren't still tasty

DAw8tw4qiPmB_glK3q7STw.text: gotta admit this place was the shiiiiiiit. if you can get in. came here after a 3 day stag do on the search for recovery. it was offered on greaseproof paper in the form of the Ari Gold with chips and slaw.burger was pretty perfect and it came out real quick.would come here all the time if it wasn't so busy. suppose thats a good thing.my mate had the chicken burger, unsure what trendy name they gave it, but it too looked excellent.impressed.

8gq9WFN2qeNZMZnMmAHudQ.text: Nice decor and atmosphere, the queues help to make you scoff down the messy burger quickly by the time you get in. The. burgers are good, but at that price they are average, there are better burgers around at a better price, but you can't fault the service or the place.

8e7KPPl-eGQv3AAikOrR0w.text: The Ari Gold cheeseburger is the most delicious thing I have put in my mouth in a long time. I also always add the extra bacon and make it even more wonderfully melting in my mouth. Even when I'm typing right now I become a bit dizzy and dreamy of it's crunchy sides and tasty buns.

HOMF8-fl2RY_xjZ1_RDMCQ.text: I did enjoy my burger but I fail to see the fascination with this place. The patty was juicy and delicious but my brioche bun was over baked and over glazed, creating an unpleasant cardboard texture in my mouth. The whole burger itself was cold. Maybe I was unlucky but I won't be rushing back. Dip and Flip was far better.

wSWgP-r_MCwR4MyGBc7Atw.text: I have a had a hell of a lot of burgers in London and the ones Patty and Bun are definitely the best. The Lambshank Redemption burger is absurdly delicious and well worth waiting for, genuinely one of the best things I've ever eaten in London. Also, prepare to be blown away by the chicken wings - it's like slow pulled pork but chicken. It melts off the bone like I've never seen chicken do before. The chicken thighs are pretty spicy, so if that's your thing then you're in luck otherwise go for the wings, they are insanely good. They stop taking take away orders at 10.15pm, but they close at 11pm, so make sure to get orders in before then. Take-away is also super quick, never had to wait more than 10 minutes.

CEIfAclIIkmPcCFtaUbQHA.text: Very good burgers.  Excellent service and good brews to go with it.  Can get busy.

o5XdM8PY6W_DlZMRWvfqDA.text: After hearing some great things, I visited P&B last week for lunch, It was so busy with a little wait for a table but I figured that could only be a good sign!  I loved the laid back atmosphere, the staff were so friendly and the whole place was buzzing. I ordered the Smokey Robinson burger which was probably the best burger I've had in London so far. As usual I got a little carried away when ordering - we had a side of the chicken wings and fries, which we probably didn't need but were a nice addition! Even though there isn't much room to spread out they offer take out which might be a good alternative whilst the weather is so lovely.Highly recommend a visit - great service & fabulous food!

k3CZqoWlIXuhXv6-ZWk56Q.text: Ok. so I am not a burger connoisseur but this burger was very, very nice. Queue outside is always a good sign, but with about 7-10 people in front of us we got a table in about 10 minutes Sunday lunchtime - not too bad at all!My friend and I decided to split Jose Jose (burger with chilli chorizo relish) and Robinson (burger with caramelised onions), both were very very good and juicy. TIp: Do flip a burger upside down so that all the juice goes into the top part of the bun and it doesn't go soggy. In the competition Jose Jose vs Robinson, Jose won - it just had more flavour and kick to it. Besides - their hot sauce is great - so make sure you help yourself to it as well.The seating is very small - fits about 30 people at a time, but people come and go rather quickly - definitely kudos to good and professional service.

lqXC-WmRvnJKybg5eI8i_g.text: There are so many burger joints in London now, but this is one of the most famous. Like many places, they don't take reservations so you just have to try your luck in the queue. I had the Lambshank Redemption burger and the chips, which were both very good but not necessarily worth the wait, in my view. The restaurant is far too small so you end up feeling quite crowded and rushed.

0AkDH_Ft9KXB14GB6MswSQ.text: Queues, queues, queues. I had already attempted to go here before but I couldn't stand waiting in line for a burger. However, turnover is fairly quick, so definitely worth it. DO NOT let Burgers & Cocktails tempt you.The restaurant is small and casual with tables you can make at home. I guess it's 'rustique'. Nice ambiance but it feels quite rushed (part of the concept to get the queues moving!!!). Not a great place to for a chat or to relax (which isn't always what you need if you just need a burger!).In terms of the food, I must say the burger was delicious. Maybe not the best I ever had, but it definitely had that US of A feel to it. The brioche is nice and the salad fresh. Speaking of salad, they actually do some quite nice side salads. The only thing I didn't like as much were the sides. Quite average at best.

0J83uEtjmCtlENEbUYv3zQ.text: Amazing burgers. We had the Smokey Robinson and the Portobello Dig It (with an extra patty) and they were terrific. We also had chicken wings and chips. Everything was perfect. The music a bit loud for such a small place, but you could talk with no problems.The 10-15 minutes of waiting outside were sure worth it.

GkHxMX1dKX3hbdbyU9GtOg.text: My favorite burger restaurant in London! The meat is cooked perfectly, always medium rare and flavorful. The bun is brioche bread and the toppings are unexpected but delicious! My favorite burger is the Ari Gold. It's a cheesy burger with a special Patty & Bun sauce that makes the burgers at P&B burgers distinct and delicious. The Ari Gold is topped with lettuce and the works along with pickled onions. I was hesitant to keep these on my burger the first time I ordered the Ari Gold, but they are now my favorite part! They're unique to P&B and give the burger a tang that is irresistible.        The wait outside the restaurant on James Street is a bummer but I often order burgers for delivery (using Jinn, a delivery app). Patty & Bun is impossible to beat... best burger in London!!

kLcTK99AlKgMtaf1OmIkJA.text: The Jose Jose chilly burgers are awesome and the wings are to die for. If you love burgers, you gotta head to this place.

4uI6lye9S6fLMts0SVBnEg.text: This place is well worth the queue.One of my favourite burger restaurants in London the food is great, the staff are friendly and the restaurant is cosy and comfortable.There's likely to be a queue when visiting due to its popularity but this is likely to be the only downside to your experience if you visit. Also if you're not up for the delicious burger the range of sides are really good too.

YvC8y4_EfDq5evy8_1sjsw.text: The smoky burger was seriously one of the best I've ever had. Love that they are served pink and juicy. Do yourself a favor and get some wings too.

i-1oc5uRFeCmiYsnAIqadw.text: Burgers are cool right now, and wherever you go in London it seems like at least one person is chatting earshot of you about the newest indie or chain that has popped up. On Sunday I enjoyed a visit to what I'm led to believe, by both friends and Shortlist, is one of the best of these new burger joints which have sprung up over the last year or so. And my god it's amazing. Staffed by girls and boys who all seemed to be Model kinds of attractive and really nice with it, there was a constant stream of folks queuing to get a seat in the small restaurant to partake in some patties and buns... and the second you sink your teeth into said ingredients you understand why - quite simply the burger that I had here was the best burger I have ever had in my life. Ever. Just the right kind of juicy, just the right level of rare, just the right amount of sweetness in the bun, just the right ... everything. And by right, I mean perfect. It was so good that I had to try really hard not to have a second helping. And almost failed. Can't rate highly enough, there needs to be a six star option for places like P&B.

ZU0T8OSTwVJmNkZ2RFZn7A.text: Tucked away in St Christophers Place, Marylebone - Patty & Bun sits between a beautiful smelling Moroccan restaurant and a tanning shop. So far so good.The first thing we noticed was the music, loud but not overpowering playing feel good music that could be gently heard from the street whilst we were waiting. Having tried Meat Liquor, Honest Burger and many of the other 'oh so cool' burger joints springing up around London I though it only fair to give this one a go.It did not disappoint, although we waited almost an hour for a table of three the food arrived very quickly and was delicious. The burger was perfectly cooked with a distinctive flavor to it's accompaniments. The Rosemary seasoned fries beautifully off set the burger. A small but well thought out drinks offer - we opted for a Wray & Ginger and it went down a treat. We will definitely return, just with looser clothing.

IObfYVhrAiC0Iaq0QlZUQA.text: I've been to Liverpool Street branch after working nearby and had the Ari Gold, skin on fries and a bottle of Red Stripe.  Also had the BBQ chicken wings. All were fantastic. I've been to their other branch and each time I've been it's been faultless. Such a great addition to the burger scene. I also love their tie ups (with Pitt Cue) they occasionally put on. I once went to the original branch at St James and had the unique collaboration burger that was called 'Beef by Dre'. It was insane.  An aged patty with bone marrow. Bone Marrow. Sold. Easily the best burger I've ever had and why I love when two great places join forces. More of these in London please.

Ns9wnPGub-Let7Ww3OQUdg.text: So for my first visit to P&B, I was really aching for the smokey robinson, but decided against it and got the lamb burger (because the last lamb burger I had at a different burger joint was just WAY oversalted!).  The turnover for lunch is quick, and our burgers arrived within 10 minutes.  I did like my lamb burger, BUT I thought it was just a tad on the oily side.  The brioche bun was nice and fluffy, glazed top - but it was just dripping in oil.  Maybe that was partly due to the deep fried buttermilk courgettes in there?  I absolutely love aubergine, but it also soaks up oil like crazy.  I know this, so maybe it was my bad on ordering this burger... it tasted good, but just a touch too greasy for my liking. The rosemary fries were good but I prefer the ones at honest burger better. Would I come back?  Yes - to try the smokey robinson and/or ari gold burgers,which seem to be the clear winners on almost everyone's list!

tUfdBnidZROUUiK_uYKr3Q.text: Patty and Bun for lunch, and we only had to wait ten minutes. Which defies all the reviews I've been reading about this place.Initially, we wanted to go Tommi's but apparently, they're lease ran out so,no tommi's for now. Anyways, they have a burger called smokey Robinson. So clever and the walls are adorned with cardboards with caricatured drawings of guns and machines. No frills. Just on cardboard, and this translates on your dinner as well. No plates, do what you do at mac d's, wax paper, chips out. But more expensive of course.I got the Ari Gold Burger with extra kimchi inside because I was craving a sticky cabbage kick that day, and the burger was good, it was a juice dripping, patty withstanding burger and it was a solid burger. Yet, I felt that it didn't wow me, not like the burger did at bar boulud or kimchi cult, or even meat liquor's dead hippy burger. Maybe, it just needs another flavour kick, pickles, chilli sauce, extra cheese. Just something.But I enjoyed my burger and it really did put me into a burger coma for the next few hours. All these yelp events are totally taking a toll on my weight and eating habits. (I know, WHAT A HARD LIFE ....)

4IIHyodIVVE2YRNoTtkIOA.text: This place is now the raining champion of burger joints. The Chicken burger is filling, full of flavour and so soft. You will not be disappointed with this place, the bun is brioche, the chips look like they were hand made and the staff are relaxed which really works for this place. The menu is short but I don't think they need anything extra, our order was mixed up and we had to wait like 5 minutes longer to get an extra burger but because of that they took that burger off the bill, that was a nice touch.All in all I have no complaints, I only have good things to say about this place

rra7oICFBBRn-j6tKvfdHg.text: The waiting times can be quite too much, BUT I promise that you will end full and very happy. Happy about that burger. Ari Gold, you are something special. Really worth the waiting times.

uE8BJUw0h0aOlgbK3rkTGw.text: After the epic 26 pub Monopoly pub crawl through London, Andrew M. suggested we hit up Patty & Bun for some after crawl burgers. Knowing how drunk we'd be (and after the crappiest burger ever we had as a break on the way), everyone thought it was a great plan, and we managed to get in with a table for eight for last orders of the night.I got the Jose Jose Chilli Burger and some Rosemary chips. The chips, while tasty, were a bit lacking in the Rosemary flavor to be honest. And the burger was good. Really good. I thought that the mix of toppings on it was really great, but the burger itself was missing something. It just seemed to act as a vehicle for the toppings instead of having delicious burgery flavor as well. The burger was perfectly good though. Really, really red in the middle for that perfect medium rare texture. Nava was a bit unsure about it, but the other half and I will work on her about how she eats her beef.If I were shopping in the area, this would be a great place to stop in for a delicious burger bite to eat. I want to try the confit chicken wings next time!

CbmqaedMWcvAursbKeiEhQ.text: This is one of my favorite burger joints in London. There burgers are outrageous. You have to try the 'ARI GOLD' Cheeseburger  and the 'Smokey Robinson' burger.Be warned there normally is a queue to get in here so be prepared to wait....Its worth it though

uvq9v9EQ7CowojW7QDz-hw.text: God this place HIT the spot perfect. From the outside it really doesn't look like much and to be honest this continues on the inside. Don't get me wrong, it's very clean and tidy ect but there's nothing eye catching about it. A friend of mine has been telling me about it for a long time now and the main reason I haven't been is 1. Distance, it's slightly out the way and 2. I have five guys burger less than 2 mins walk from my house. Prior to going here I was convinced it was going to be just ok and no where near as good as five guys...well I was wrong. The burgers are out of this world. The staff ask how you would like the meat cooked and this is a brilliant touch. I asked for medium and when my bacon burger arrived it was overflowing with juices and sat in a sweet soft bun. The chips are cooked with Rosemary and taste good, portion size is just right. I also tried the wings and I liked them but my friend wasn't too impressed. The meat was sooo soft and they had a lot of sauce on them. Would I return? Hell yeah.

SKczvzTDB5mjpAAvL5pdaw.text: LOVE THIS DINER !!!Best burger in town - for me anyway - hehe! Jokes aside, this is a serious burger joint. Yes, mind the queue which may have you waiting 10-20 minutes, but trust me the wait is worth every minute. Ari Gold burger kills; chips also solid. It's loud and fun. Go with a group of friends - you will thank me.
